description: Aim to increase the consumption of whole, unprocessed foods while reducing reliance on highly processed and refined foods.
name: Whole Foodie

description: Increasing the intake of healthy fats (monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats) while minimizing saturated and trans fats.
name: Healthy Fatty

description: Aim to provide a type of diet that includes fish and other seafood but excludes other types of meat such as poultry, beef, and pork. Supplement with fish and shellfish.
name: Pescatarian

description: A dietary approach that emphasizes the consumption of uncooked, unprocessed, and often organic foods.
name: Raw Food

description: Limit the intake of added sugars and set goals for reducing sugar consumption from processed foods and beverages.
name: Mindfully Sweet

description: Adhere to ketogenic or low-carb dietary patterns, ensuring sufficient healthy fats and minimal carbohydrate intake.
name: Keto or Low-Carb Devotee

description: Excludes all forms of dairy products.
name: Dairy-free

description: Aim to consume a wide variety of ingredients from multiple food groups.
name: Diverse Eater

description: Based on the traditional dietary patterns of countries bordering the Mediterranean Sea. It includes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, fish, and olive oil while limiting red meat and dairy.
name: Mediterranean Diet

description: Promote a healthy gut microbiome, including prebiotics and probiotics.
name: Gut Health

description: Prioritize heart and brain health by including foods that support healthy cholesterol levels and blood pressure.
name: Heart and Brain Healthy

description: Prioritize the intake of essential vitamins and minerals through a varied and nutrient-dense diet.
name: Micronutrient Intake

description: Vegetarian, includes dairy products (lacto) and eggs (ovo). Individuals following this diet abstain from all forms of meat, including fish and poultry. Lacto-ovo vegetarians obtain their protein from plant sources, dairy, and eggs.
name: Lacto-Ovo-Tarian

description: Use low-cost, basic ingredients to create a nutritional diet.
name: Budget Friendly

description: Equal ratios of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats to achieve a balanced diet.
name: Balanced Macros
